document.title: Designing Electronic Journals with 30 Years of Lessons Learned from Print: Economic and Use Patterns of Scientific Journals.
document.abstract: Scientists find journals useful, both for their teaching and their research — so useful, in fact, that they are willing to pay for them. If electronic journals prove to be as useful, or more useful, their viability is assured.
document.publication-title: School of Information Sciences -- Faculty Publications and Other Works

field.name: custom_citation
field.value: Carol Tenopir and Donald W. King. “Designing Electronic Journals with 30 Years of Lessons Learned from Print: Economic and Use Patterns of Scientific Journals.” Journal of Electronic Publishing (December 1998). URL: http://www.press.umich.edu/jep/04-02/king.html.
